description: The Museum of Enfield is this year bringing its temporary exhibition to you! “From Enfield to Fork” explores the borough’s history and relationship with food, from Roman Enfield to Market Gardening.

events.name: Enfield to Fork
events.notes: Visitors can arrive at any time during the opening hours.There may be queues at busy times.

events.name: Enfield to Fork
events.notes: Visitors can arrive at any time during the opening hours.There may be queues at busy times.

factsheet.heading: Exhibition Theme
paragraphs:
Enfield has played a pivotal role in providing fresh
produce to the London market for generations. From
a Roman settlement in the Lea Valley, via a thriving
market town and surrounding villages, to today’s food
loving borough.

This exhibition explores the borough’s history and
relationship with food, how Enfield became a hub for
cooking appliances and food innovation and has been
at the centre of food production for years.

images.title: Exhibition in its first location, Grovelands Park

travel_info: Nearest train: Meridian Water, Edmonton Green, Silver Street

name: Enfield To Fork - Pymmes Park
